content:
@Mike Rossiter

I have setup things for continued development and pushed these changes:

  • The master branch is now heading for 3.3, whatever that will mean. This should be our primary development branch.
  • The v3.2 branch is supposed to contain cherry-picked commits from master which might end up in a 3.2.2 release.

Please rebase or pull master to get in sync.

I suggest that we try to organize this in a way that you are responsible for the master branch while I take care of the v3.2 branch. This would mean that I avoid making direct pushes to master, using PRs instead. OTOH, I just push to v3.2. OK?

Sorry for late pushes to master. The situation was a bit stressful when I realized that the release I just had announced actually used bogus tags (yes, it did). When you did not reply at once I felt I had to act. Let's hope something similar does not happen again.

I just push to v3.2. OK?

That is fine for v3.2. PR for master.
